channel.title: American Thinker
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site, subject to copyright and fair use.

item.title: The Dream of a World Without Oil
item.description: 3,800,000 wind turbines? This one sounds more like a nightmare.

item.title: Obama's Tyranny: Petty or Something More Sinister?
item.description: the Administration is holding a gun to the head of almost every single American in its quest to inflict the maximum pain possible on each of us to achieve its political objectives. When has this occurred in our country's history?

item.title: In Defense of Racial Humor
item.description: If laughter really is the best medicine, it's no wonder race relations are in a state of ill health.

item.title: Barack Obama's Excellent Israeli Adventure
item.description: With a kippah on his head and a truckful of platitudes in tow.

item.title: The Pool of Narcissus
item.description: While society renders lip service to altruism and the affectation of selflessness, the prevailing culture in America today marinates in the worship of Self.

item.title: Is It Time to Legalize Heterosexual Marriage?
item.description: There's a piece missing from the "gay marriage" puzzle.

item.title: The Left's Moral Relativism
item.description: The chaos that would arise without moral standards would appear to be self-evident. But don't expect the left to understand that.

item.title: The Wine, Women and Song Foundation
item.description: I have watched over the years how publicly unaccountable foundations have amassed billions of dollars, tax free, and spend it on dangerous, leftwing, often anti-American and anti-Israeli outfits, conferences and promoters.

item.title: Does Progressivism Exist?
item.description: Is there really such a thing as progressivism? Or is it no more than a mirage -- a mirage leading into a deadly bog of social and political quicksand?

item.title: Blurred Image: How Even Free Speech's Defenders Must Defer to Islam
item.description: An otherwise well-documented and stirring defense of intellectual freedom recently shocked its audience with one cinematic bow to Islamic sensitivities.

item.title: Apple's Disappearing Cursor and Corporate Arrogance
item.description: Here's one example of how the market corrects errors.

item.title: When It Comes to Russia, We Told You So
item.description: Thanks to the world's ignorance and indifference, Vladimir Putin has had years of precious time to consolidate a new Soviet Union.

item.title: MURPH: The Protector: Hollywood Gets One Right
item.description: This is the sort of movie that should be coming regularly out of Tinseltown.

item.title: The Power Motive and the Profit Motive
item.description: The most common misconception in America's warped political culture is that modern liberals tend to be altruistic and compassionate, while conservatives are self-centered, greedy old misers.

item.title: Ryan Budget: Better than the Senate's, but That's About It
item.description: Ryan's budget is hardly a small-government plan of action. And it was decried in hysterical tones by the left and the media anyway.

item.title: Twitter and Antisemitism
item.description: A new collective phenomenon, the ability to express hate without fear of retribution.

item.title: The Brain Eaters Invade Massachusetts Middle School
item.description: Utter capitulation to the self esteem movement

item.title: Passover's gift: The Promised and Undivided Land
item.description: Such a seminal event in humanity's history became the foundation for freedom and liberty-- created many centuries before democracy was first enunciated by Greeks

item.title: Real Bullies: The Homosexuality Is Normal Movement
item.description: The Homosexuality Is Normal Movement is not made up of passive, well-meaning victims simply seeking tolerance and their place in the sun.

item.title: Dangerous Times: Crypto-Fascism in Italy, Hungary, Greece, Albania
item.description: A great sense of alarm is spreading among ordinary Europeans today, especially in the south and east of the continent. People are finally starting to take the signs of foundation-shaking turmoil seriously.

item.title: We're All CVS Employees Now
item.description: Soon, all Americans must disclose their weight, BMI, and smoking habits to the government - and "surprise health inspections" may well be in the works, too.

item.title: Ho Chi Minh (Saigon): Where Everyone Knows Bill Clinton's Name
item.description: You cannot miss that Saigon, as natives still call this city, is booming. Writer Gemma Price reports the swinging spots -- Blanchey's Tash, Chill's (sky bar and lounge, and restaurant) and Bobby Chinn's whose specialty is seafood ceviche with coconut...

item.title: Mental Illness and Guns
item.description: Nearly two-thirds of all mass shooting involve individuals suffering from serious mental illness -- but Senator Feinstein is away from her desk.

item.title: Apartheid Week: The Modern Blood Libel
item.description: Islamists are targeting the American higher educational system. ...and American educators welcome them with open arms.

item.title: Deepwater Horizon: Coulda, Shoulda, Woulda
item.description: Even now, one seems to have any interest in taking responsibility when it comes to the Deepwater Horizon disaster.
